ETL Package

Submodules

etl.config module

Defines a Config class to read the AWS EMR configuration from etl.cfg file.

config.CONFIG_EMR_PATH = '/home/woox/Develop/datadiver-aws-emr/src/etl/etl.cfg'

The config file absolute path in the AWS EMR environment.

config.CONFIG_LOCAL_PATH = '/home/woox/Develop/datadiver-aws-emr/src/etl/etl.cfg'

The config file absolute path in the local environment.

config.CONFIG_NAME = 'etl.cfg'

The config file name.

class config.Config(local=False)

This class defines a wrapper for ConfigParser.

Use the etl.cfg file as a reference to configure the application according to your AWS account settings.

Usage example:

config = Config() config.get(‘S3’, ‘LANDING’)

get(section, option)

Reads a config option value from a section.

Retrieves an option value pertaining to the given section from the etl.cfg file.

Parameters

  • section – The etl.cfg file section name. E.g. EMR

  • option – The section config option name. E.g. CLUSTER_ID

Returns

A value to the given section and option. For example:

value = config.get(‘EMR’, ‘CLUSTER_ID’)

config.PACKAGE_DIR = 'etl'

The python package name.

config.PACKAGE_PATH = '/home/woox/Develop/datadiver-aws-emr/src'

The python package path.

config.SCRIPT_DIR = '/home/woox/Develop/datadiver-aws-emr/src/etl'

The python script directory path.

config.SCRIPT_NAME = 'config.py'

The python script file name.

config.SCRIPT_PATH = '/home/woox/Develop/datadiver-aws-emr/src/etl/config.py'

The python script absolute file path.

etl.metadata module

Defines metadata for table schema data types and columns.

metadata.columns = {'artists': {'json': ['artist_id', 'artist_name', 'artist_location', 'artist_latitude', 'artist_longitude'], 'table': ['artist_id', 'name', 'location', 'latitude', 'longitude']}, 'songplays': {'json': ['level', 'location', 'userAgent', 'sessionId', 'itemInSession', 'userId', 'ts', 'song', 'artist', 'length'], 'table': ['songplay_id', 'level', 'location', 'user_agent', 'session_id', 'user_id', 'song_id', 'artist_id', 'start_time', 'year', 'month']}, 'songs': {'json': ['song_id', 'title', 'year', 'duration', 'artist_id'], 'table': ['song_id', 'title', 'year', 'duration', 'artist_id']}, 'time': {'json': ['ts'], 'table': ['start_time', 'hour', 'day', 'week', 'month', 'year', 'weekday']}, 'users': {'json': ['userId', 'firstName', 'lastName', 'gender', 'level'], 'table': ['user_id', 'first_name', 'last_name', 'gender', 'level']}}

Defines the lists of columns for each table.

metadata.schema = {'logs': StructType([StructField('level', StringType(), True), StructField('location', StringType(), True), StructField('userAgent', StringType(), True), StructField('sessionId', LongType(), True), StructField('itemInSession', IntegerType(), True), StructField('userId', StringType(), True), StructField('firstName', StringType(), True), StructField('lastName', StringType(), True), StructField('gender', StringType(), True), StructField('ts', LongType(), True), StructField('song', StringType(), True), StructField('artist', StringType(), True), StructField('length', DoubleType(), True), StructField('page', StringType(), True)]), 'songs': StructType([StructField('song_id', StringType(), True), StructField('title', StringType(), True), StructField('year', IntegerType(), True), StructField('duration', DoubleType(), True), StructField('artist_id', StringType(), True), StructField('artist_name', StringType(), True), StructField('artist_location', StringType(), True), StructField('artist_latitude', DoubleType(), True), StructField('artist_longitude', DoubleType(), True)])}

Defines a dictionary of table schemas.

etl.pipeline module

Defines the ETLPipeline class to extract json data from the AWS S3 bucket, transform them with Spark, and load them back into S3 as a set of dimensional parquet tables.

class pipeline.ETLPipeline(config)

This class defines the AWS EMR ETL pipeline.

Code usage example with default config:

config = Config() pipeline = ETLPipeline(config) pipeline.run()

Usage example as python script with local config: python -m etl –local

start()

Execute all pipeline phases and print time statistics.

stop()

Stop the pipeline SparkContext.

Module contents

class etl.Config(local=False)

This class defines a wrapper for ConfigParser.

Use the etl.cfg file as a reference to configure the application according to your AWS account settings.

Usage example:

config = Config() config.get(‘S3’, ‘LANDING’)

get(section, option)

Reads a config option value from a section.

Retrieves an option value pertaining to the given section from the etl.cfg file.

Parameters

  • section – The etl.cfg file section name. E.g. EMR

  • option – The section config option name. E.g. CLUSTER_ID

Returns

A value to the given section and option. For example:

value = config.get(‘EMR’, ‘CLUSTER_ID’)

class etl.ETLPipeline(config)

This class defines the AWS EMR ETL pipeline.

Code usage example with default config:

config = Config() pipeline = ETLPipeline(config) pipeline.run()

Usage example as python script with local config: python -m etl –local

start()

Execute all pipeline phases and print time statistics.

stop()

Stop the pipeline SparkContext.
